contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2007}} This article lists forms of '''Transport in the Netherlands Antilles'''. ==Rail== No railway tracks exist in the Netherlands Antilles ==Roads== All driving is on the right. '''Highways:''' <br>''total:'' 600 km <br>''paved:'' 300 km <br>''unpaved:'' 300 km (1992 est.) ==Sea== '''Ports and harbours:''' Kralendijk ([[Bonaire]]), Philipsburg ([[Saint Martin]]), Willemstad ([[Curaçao]]) '''Merchant marine:''' <br>''total:'' 110 ships (1,000 GRT or over) totaling 1,028,910 GRT/{{DWT|1,285,837|metric|first=yes}} <br>''ships by type:'' bulk 2, cargo 27, chemical tanker 2, combination ore/oil 3, container 16, liquified gas 4, multi-functional large load carrier 18, passenger 1, petroleum tanker 5, refrigerated cargo 26, roll-on/roll-off 6 (1999 est.) <br>''note:'' a [[flag of convenience]] registry; includes ships of 2 countries: Belgium owns 9 ships, Germany 1 (1998 est.) ==Air== '''Airports:''' 5 (2005 est.) '''Airports - with paved runways:''' <br>''total:'' 5 <br>''over 3,047 m:'' 1 <br>''2,438 to 3,047 m:'' 1 <br>''1,524 to 2,437 m:'' 1 <br>''914 to 1,523 m:'' 1 <br>''under 914 m:'' 1 (2005 est.) *[[List of airports in the Netherlands Antilles]] ==See also== [[Netherlands Antilles]] {{Americas topic|Transport in}} [[Category:Transport in the Netherlands Antilles| ]] {{NetherlandsAntilles-stub}} {{Curaçao-stub}} {{SintMaarten-stub}}
